section:
Maka is the dread goddess of disease and famine, who must be propitiated to ensure good harvests. When Maka is angry, the crops are struck with pestilence and people go hungry. Her temple is a high-gabled building of dark wood with narrow leaded lights that admit only a dismal gloom to the interior of the nave.
